paper.title: The Impact of Individual Investor Trading on Stock Returns
paper.abstract: In this paper, we study the impact of the trading of individual investors on short-horizon stock returns from 2005 to 2006 using a unique data set provided by the Taiwan Stock Exchange. We examine the predictability of stock returns based on net individual trading by using the portfolio-sorting approach and the Fama-MacBeth regression method. Contrary to previously offered conclusions, we find that the imbalance in individual trading negatively predicts future stock returns on a stock-by-stock basis, which indicates that individual investors can be viewed as noise traders to some extent. At the same time, using the principal component analysis, we find that the noise trading of individuals is not systematic.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究个体投资者交易对股票回报的影响，虽然使用了金融数据分析方法，但其核心研究并不直接涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理。
